html:
** Shares of Apple AAPL.O, Microsoft MSFT.O and Google owner Alphabet GOOGL.O, the three biggest U.S. cos by market cap, down 1%-1.5% premarket

** Tech heavyweights fall amid wider selloff in global markets on fears over a new, potentially vaccine-resistant COVID-19 variant (Full Story)

** Little is known of the variant, detected in S. Africa, Botswana and Hong Kong, but scientists say it has an unusual combination of mutations, may be able to evade immune responses and could be more transmissible (Full Story)

** Black Friday shoppers find products such as AAPL's iPhones and MSFT's Xbox consoles out of stock amid global chip shortages (Full Story) (Full Story)

** Other trillion-dollar cos Amazon.com AMZN.O and Tesla TSLA.O drop 0.4% and 2.3%, respectively

** AMZN's Black Friday in Europe kicks off with protests by climate activists, delivery workers and drivers at some of its depots (Full Story)

** TSLA withdraws its possible 1.14 bln euros ($1.29 bln) state funding application in Germany for planned EV battery production (Full Story)

** Meta Platforms FB.O declines 1.4%, Twitter TWTR.N slides 2.1%

** Chipmaker NVIDIA NVDA.O loses 1.9%

** On the other hand, shares of 'stay-at-home' tech stocks like Netflix NFLX.O and Zoom Video Communications ZM.O rise as countries consider or reinstate travel bans (Full Story) (Full Story)


($1 = 0.8857 euros)


(Reporting by Ruhi Soni in Bengaluru;)

(( Ruhi.Soni@thomsonreuters.com ; Twitter: https://twitter.com/ruhithere; ))
